attributes.action: remove the exemption which allows MPs to avoid income tax on expense payments.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When employees are paid expenses which HM Revenue & Customs considers to be not 'wholly and necessarily incurred' in the course of their business, then the payment is considered to be income and is taxed.

Section 292 of the Income Tax Act 2003 specifically exempts MPs (and MSPs and AMs) from paying tax on expenses, whatever they are paid for, and however unreasonable they may be.

This petition seeks to repeal this exemption.
